# Webgl page with interactive controls (2026-02-02 02:54Z)

_**User**_

make a page on this site where it has a big webgl area with a set of parameters. i can select from an existing image (maybe make a few) or upload my own. i can also tweak the various params in real time. think of lots of different ways to control on the front end what's going on in the actual canvas

---

_**Agent (model claude-4.5-opus-high-thinking, mode Agent)**_

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
The user wants me to create a new page on their site with a WebGL playground/editor where they can:
1. Select from existing images or upload their own
2. Tweak various parameters in real time
3. Have lots of different controls for the WebGL canvas

Let me first read the project rules and understand the codebase structure, then look at the existing WebGL implementation to understand what's already there.</details></think>

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
I've created the WebGL playground page. Let me provide a summary of what was built for the user.</details></think>

---

I've created a comprehensive WebGL playground page at `/playground`. Here's what you can do with it:

**Image Controls**
- Select from 7 preset images (Luis, Pelican, Leaves, Noice, Hamburger, Jump City, Spooky Looper)
- Upload your own image via file picker

**6 Built-in Presets**
- Default (subtle waves)
- Psychedelic (intense swirls)
- Glitch Art (digital chaos)
- Calm Waters (gentle flow)
- Vortex (spinning center)
- Retro VHS (vintage vibes)

**Interactive Controls**
1. **Sliders** - for all 30+ parameters with color-coded categories
2. **XY Pads** - for positioning ripple and swirl centers interactively
3. **Direction toggles** - for pixel sort direction (horizontal/vertical)
4. **Canvas click** - click anywhere on the canvas to set effect centers
5. **Randomize button** - generates interesting random combinations
6. **Play/Pause** - control the animation loop
7. **Collapsible sections** - keep the UI organized

**Effect Categories**
- **Global**: overall intensity and time speed
- **Waves**: frequency, speed, amplitude for X and Y axes
- **Ripples**: frequency, speed, amplitude + XY center position
- **Swirl**: strength, radius, speed + XY center position
- **Turbulence**: amount and speed for X and Y
- **Pixel Sorting**: intensity, threshold, direction
- **Color**: hue shift, saturation, brightness, contrast
- **Effects**: glitch, scanlines, noise, blur, vignette

**Stats Bar** shows real-time FPS, intensity multiplier, time speed, and active preset.

To try it, navigate to `/playground` on your local dev server. Want me to make any adjustments to the controls or add additional effect types?

üìù **Changelog updated** - Added entry for WebGL playground page with interactive shader parameter controls

---

_**User**_

make this feel more brutalist, more more responsive

---

_**Agent (model claude-4.5-opus-high-thinking, mode Agent)**_

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
The user wants the WebGL playground page to feel more brutalist (raw, bold, exposed structure aesthetic) and more responsive (better mobile/tablet support). Let me update both the CSS and potentially some of the JSX to achieve this.

Brutalist design characteristics:
- Raw, exposed structure
- Bold typography
- High contrast
- Monospace fonts
- Minimal decoration
- Raw borders instead of shadows
- Harsh/angular elements
- Often black and white or limited color palette

Let me read the current files and update them.</details></think>

---

I'll update the playground to have a more brutalist aesthetic with better responsive design.
